result.execSummary:
The defendant Gabriel G Chapin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action.  (costs have been paid in full from cash bond posted)
Maintain full-time employment as directed by Dept. of Corrections.
No contact with R.H. or his residence.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Take all medications as prescribed.
Restitution and statutorily authorized surcharges have been paid in full.

timeConds.notes: STAYED.   To be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. If stay is lifted, huber release is granted.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gabriel G Chapin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Restitution summary
to Randy Chapin for refund of remainder of cash bond. Check #10306.
for DNA Sample

Defendant Gabriel G Chapin in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State amends Ct. 1 to Misdemeanor Battery, gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to amended Ct. 1 and Ct. 2 as charged. .  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of amended Ct. 1 and Ct. 2 as charged. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Atty Reetz indicates matter is resolved, asks court to set a plea/sentencing date in 90 days.  Bond remains as is.
State's Discovery Demand

Defendant Gabriel G Chapin in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 11:30 am.
from Atty Reetz indicating defendant is not contesting the findings of Dr. Galli.

Defendant Gabriel G Chapin in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Reetz indicates they aren't contesting the findings of Dr. Galli. Court questions defendant whether he feels he's competent to proceed. Defendant feels he's competent to proceed. State asks court to rely on the findings of Dr. Galli. Court finds defendant competent to proceed. Atty Reetz doesn't want to do the arraignment today, asks court to set arraignment date. State indicates defendant hasn't had a preliminary hearing yet. Atty Reetz indicates prelim. will be a waiver. Court sets waiver of prelim/arraignment date. Bond remains in effect.  Waiver of Prelim scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Competency hearing at 01-08-2016 02:30 pm
from Atty Reetz requesting 30-60 day continuance of competency hearing. Court reschedules matter.
Competency hearing at 01-14-2016 02:30 pm
from Atty Reetz indicating he is not ready to proceed with competency hearing on 10/05/15, requests adjournment. ADA Korb has no objection to adjournment. Court reschedules.
Competency hearing at 11-05-2015 09:15 am

Attorney Brett E Reetz in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in the file, reviews letter from Atty Reetz. Court indicates competency report was filed with the court yesterday, 9/10/15. Court makes good cause finding to extend the competency hearing as State/Defense not ready to proceed because of the late filing of the competency report.  Competency hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 03:45 pm.
from Atty Reetz indicating he has not received a copy of the competency report yet.
Competency report done by Dr. Galli.
by DHS

Defendant Gabriel G Chapin in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Atty Reetz questions defendants competency, requests court order competency evaluation. Court makes a finding that there is sufficient probable cause to order a competency evaluation. Court orders the Wisconsin Forensic Unit to preform a competency evaluation. Bond remains in effect.  Competency hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 10:30 am.
from Atty Reetz  indicating defendant was admitted to an inpatient treatment program and as of this morning hasn't been released.

Copy of criminal complaint given to Atty Reetz. Atty Reetz was in court on another matter, asked to have this case rescheduled as defendant is receiving some medical treatment and won't be in court at 10:00 today. DA Pelrine had no objection to rescheduling.
Initial appearance at 08-10-2015 11:30 am
Defendant was fingerprinted 7/18/15 by jail staff. (fingerprint card destroyed 5/18/16)
from defendants parents regarding the situation.
No contact direct or indirect with R.H. or his residence at 1205 East Side Road, Washington Island.   To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Gabriel G Chapin appears by video conference.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 10:00 am.
